input: should I set up my second bank account with different bank I have right now?
gold_answer: There are advantages and disadvantages to keeping all your accounts with the same bank versus having accounts at different banks. If you open a second account at a different bank, you may have more options for products like Mortgage or credit extensions since you are not limited to just one institution. If you use the same bank, that would make it harder to lose track of, and you could probably still get reports summarizing the balances across them. Additionally, occasionally there are also perks like the bank spontaneously offering you increased credit or even a whole line of credit because the bank has your data already.

retrieved_contexts.text: Why not just open multiple accounts at the same bank? That would make it harder to lose track of, and you could probably still get reports summarizing the balances across them. I do this and it works well, my credit union even lets me name each account so it is easy to keep them straight.

I've had all my account with the same bank for all my life. Generally, the disadvantage is that if I want some kind of product like a credit extension or a mortgage, I have the one bank to go to and if they don't want to help me I'm out of luck. However, occasionally there are also perks like the bank spontaneously offering you increased credit or even a whole line of credit. They can do this because they have your whole history and trust you.
